website_summaries.verdict: An affordable Moka pot for high-end espresso tastes.
pros: Compared to espresso brewed in an Italian cafe, this Moka pot delivers in terms of ease of use and the ability to bring the most out of basic to fine roasts
cons: Finding the right starting temperature may take a few tries

customer_reviews.title: Silver paint flaking and rubbing off of inside
customer_reviews.text: Silver paint on the inside flakes and rubs off onto fingers. Seriously wondering, IS THIS METAL FOOD SAFE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: jason douglas

customer_reviews.title: This is a coffee pot that will likely make you sick
customer_reviews.text: I got the pot in the mail, washed it out before use, but after a couple sips of my coffee I saw little silver specs in my mug. I rubbed my fingers along the inside of the water container, and my fingers were silver. I'm not ingesting that garbage! Sent it back the day.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Mackall

customer_reviews.title: Chipping aluminum inside
customer_reviews.text: I never even got to taste it! After my first batch, the one you throw out, I noticed that the aluminum at the base of the stem in the top pot was chipping off. I'm returning it. I was so excited, too. :(
customer_reviews.author: knows stuff about things...

customer_reviews.title: What I dislike about today's products...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely detest anything made in China, but labels know this so they go to GREAT LENGTHS to advertise everywhere else but! Like this Moka pot right here-they go on and on about how they are 'from New York' and that Bellemain is 'Italian' but they flat out fail to mention in their little story of wonderfulness that it is really made in CHINA-nothing authentic about it at all. I gave this for a gift and told them to donate it to a thrift shop. I have to be more careful but I believe the FIRST THING listed should be what a product is made of AND where it is manufactured!!!
customer_reviews.author: MyFiona

customer_reviews.title: Good cup of coffee..
customer_reviews.text: Product works as advertised. Makes 6 - 2 ounces shots or 1 regular cup of coffee. A bit small for my needs. Great for single use needs. If using a gas stovetop, be sure to use the smallest burner. Handle does get a bit warm.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Terribly constructed
customer_reviews.text: I got one decent pot of espresso out of this before I washed it and found that the entire thing oxidized. I handwashed then put it on the top rack of the dishwasher to drip dry, and when I pulled it out my fingers came away grey from all the powdered aluminum sloughing off of the thing. It's going straight back.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Defective manufacturing in two units
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly familiar with this type of unit and have used a similar one for years which broke and prompted this purchase. Have just purchased one to use and one to gift. The one I used today leaked at the joint during brewing. It is probably usable though annoying. The one I gifted is unusable and has a small hole in the side of the base near the bottom through which all the water leaks out. I am embarrassed to have given this and will replace it with a better made product. Very disappointed and cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diana L.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess on stove
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use this, learned how to brew moka while we were in Rome. Unfortunately it made a mess when starting to boil on the stovetop. The brim of the bottom part where you fill up with water has an uneven surface. Doesn't seem to be chipped or broken, but water seeps out and spills all over the stove. If it weren't for that it works how it's supposed to. Returning this product, can't be cleaning up every time we use it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Makes a delicious  mug of coffee or 6 espresso cups
customer_reviews.text: I really like this moka. I bought it to replace a generic 3 cup one that I had purchased for a couple of bucks in Brazil several years ago. The handle had burned off. This moka is bigger and the handle does not get hot. So you can just pour It without using a potholder. I like the test of the coffee a lot. It tastes smooth and hearty. (I'm using Lavazza, a good Italian brand). In my old moka the coffee was bitter, no matter what brand of coffee I used. The moka is very shiny and looks nice. It definitely is a good quality piece of equipment and I've very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lucero

customer_reviews.title: Brews fine - spout dribbles...
customer_reviews.text: I like the pot - it brews just fine... but the spout dribbles when you pour. I thought it might be the seal between the top and bottom of the pot... but it's not. The dribble is apparently a very common moka pot issue... the 3 cup Bialetti I got at the same time as this Bellemain has the same dribble. Interesting the generic or ?? pot I used on a recent trip had no dribble... Lots of reviews talk about the general moka dribble... water surface tension, spout design, other opinions... an irritant... but it brews great coffee...
customer_reviews.author: Marty Amble

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed...great product and well priced.
customer_reviews.text: This Expresso maker is well priced and it works. It screws on nicely and the outside chrome finish is well done. No leaks and it pours well from the spout. My son has two Expresso makers with a different brand and they are no where close to the performance of this Bellemain Expresso maker. I'll get a 9 cup on my next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gift

customer_reviews.title: It worked great the first 2-3 times an then it just started ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great the first 2-3 times an then it just started spewing water out where you put it together. Made sure there was no coffee grounds an it was all clean and screwed on tightly. And it still does it. And when it does that it doesn’t make a good espresso.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Coblentz

customer_reviews.title: Works well, once you realize how hard you have to turn to tighten it
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give it a crappy review for a few reasons: 1. This does not make espresso. It's an Italian percolator. It makes strong coffee, sure, but it's not espresso. 2. It was leaking on the side, where the top joins with the reservoir. However: 1. I'm not nit-picky about names and 2. I hadn't tightened it fully. I'll knock off a star because it IS hard to get it tight enough to prevent leaking, but overall it's working quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: An Awesome Brew!
customer_reviews.text: This little mokapot makes outstanding espresso style coffee. producing a rich, aromatic brew and a nice head of crema. My favorite has been a Sumatra single-origin, starting from whole beans. Follow the directions when brewing, and remove the pot from the stove just as the coffee reaches the bottom of the pouring spout and it will finish without over spray. To clean, rinse with hot water and wipe with a paper towel. Plus it looks great sitting on my stove. Bellisimo!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent expresso
customer_reviews.text: This makes good expresso. You have to watch it carefully and take it off the fire as soon as all the water from the bottom has brewed. Otherwise your coffee will get too cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Chun

customer_reviews.title: Authentic Italian style coffee pot works well, good value
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what you would find in an Italian market at a similar price. This pot works great and gives my mokka grind coffee a great flavor. Works best for about 4 smaller servings at a time or one euro sized mug. As wih all authentic style steam pots, there will eventually be some corrosion inside but this does not affect the function or flavor. Works just as fast as a drip machine and tastes so much better. Easy clean up too, only three parts, wipe with a sponge and rinse.
customer_reviews.author: LXXV

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso coffee
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee pot for making Espresso coffee. Easy to use: put the water in the bottom half, put the coffee in the basket and screw the top part back on. Place it on the smaller burner (gas or electric) and let it percolate. The coffee is done when it stops percolating and all the water has risen to the top part. Easy to clean: dump the coffee grounds into the trash and just rinse all parts of the pot with warm water then dry with a paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: Lilli Ann

customer_reviews.title: Don’t make coffee in Aluminum!!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize this was aluminum which is a horrible product to heat at high temps and consume food or drinks. It also came scratched up with flakes of metal inside.
customer_reviews.author: Janna May

customer_reviews.title: but as you may know we coffee fiends like ot have more options
customer_reviews.text: Anyone that uses these are coffee fans to aficionados. I have a similar unit, but as you may know we coffee fiends like ot have more options. At any rate, If you order that leading brand in this style, you'll be throwing money away. This Bellemain Espresso maker is of equal of even greater that the quality of the other brand. In fact, the build seems identical. This makes delicious coffee, and the unit is a great value. It should serve you well over many years.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J Gaudette

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I was in Italy, where most homes have one of these, I was looking to buy one. This one fits the bill nicely. It's solid and heavy. I washed it and ran it through a couple of cycles before use. I never experienced any "chipping" or flaking of the material. The coffee from it was excellent. I've used it 20-30 times already and I'm very happy with the coffee it makes.
customer_reviews.author: Halef and Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent service
customer_reviews.text: I used one of these every day for about 2 years until I got talking to my neighbor (6 feet apart!) outside and forgot it on the stove. It held up to that scorching well but I treated myself to to a new one. It came on time but the lid was a little rattle-y. I had a replacement the very next day!! Not sure how that was possible but it happened. I returned the rattle-y topped one and the new one is just as wonderful as the original one I burned up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the flavor is not as good. The difference is noticable
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy this "off-brand" moka pot as well as the "leading" brand and can confirm it's worth paying more for the leading brand. This off-brand moka pot doesn't seal as well so a lot of water is lost in the process. Plus, the flavor is not as good. The difference is noticable. I would have given only two-stars but figured the $15 price warrants a third star. Will be my back up moka pot.
customer_reviews.author: Wind Energy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great the 1st 6 times then doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to finally have fresh espresso in the morning but after about making 6-12 great cups of coffee it stopped. Working altogether. It's tin, not stainless steel and the rubber seal wears out immediately. The last thing i want to do is replace it after every 8 cups I make.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little Moka pot. Easy to use and clean. Coffee taste excellent. Very, very please with it. highly recommended to anyone that enjoys a good cup of coffee
customer_reviews.author: Yalc

customer_reviews.title: Simple, excellent espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: You don't really have to buy an expensive device that blows out your coffee in like a rocket taking off. The Bellemain creates excellent coffee without scaring you. The results are tasty and satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Montague Catway

customer_reviews.title: Great little pot!
customer_reviews.text: This a nice little mocha pot. I am really happy with this pot. I have been looking at these for ages and finally decided to try it. It makes enough for two cups of coffee with creamer. I use a lot of creamer. I like latte as opposed to espresso. It does leak a bit from the seal. But not a deal breaker for me. I have purchased extra seals for when this one wears out. It’s pretty easy to clean. I use it almost every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, rich, mug of coffee
customer_reviews.text: I've used the other famous brand "two-cup" for years but it's only half-cup by American standards. When I finally went shopping for an American size infusion moka maker, this Bellemain popped-up. I bought it. It is sooo wonderful to have a perfect rich mug of coffee now with my breakfast instead of the child's portion to which I've been subjected for so long. This is a fine product. Season it by discarding the initial cup, never use dish soap (I know, hard to make yourself do it, but don't) just rinse with water, and enjoy a unique rich textured coffee American style. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Noecker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good Espresso Pot
customer_reviews.text: My only issue is that it's hard to get the coffee filter out to clean it. I have to use a knife with a really pointy tip to pop it up. Other than that it's a good deal for your money.
customer_reviews.author: gBoston

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t make 6 shots, doesn’t produce espresso-level flavor.
customer_reviews.text: I compared this with a smaller-capacity Italian-made Bialetti I found at a thrift store and the Bellemain just comes up short every time. I’ve experimented with different ratios of espresso to water, but the Bellemain always results in weaker and less flavorful coffee than the Bialetti. It produces more of a drip-coffee flavor than the espresso you would expect. The size is also deceptive- it doesn’t make 6 cups or shots of anything! I used it with a 4 oz demitasse mug, and even with a full filter of espresso, the flavor and amount is off.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ceci

customer_reviews.title: Repurchased this 2 times to gift to others!
customer_reviews.text: There are many out there like this, but they are cheap knock offs. This "Bellemain" one is far superior and the only one i recommend. Pls DO NOT PUT IN DISHWASHER or you will ruin it. Also i am sure to handle this with extreme car to avoid it being bent (especially the filter insert).
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Amoury

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Received this espresso maker the Saturday before Christmas. The quality of it is wonderful! Very sturdy and durable. The metal is nice and thick. Only thing is it takes a little longer than my smaller espresso maker but it’s because it’s way bigger. All espresso makers are somewhat difficult to clean but this one isn’t the worst. Overall the quality of espresso made is fabulous. The price is great and the quality is even better! Highly recommend for any coffe lovers who need an extra kick to start their day!
customer_reviews.author: The Baddest Alive

customer_reviews.title: Love this Stove Top Espresso Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a real verified review, no favors. I really like this espresso maker. Most of the time I use it for americano coffee size and not the 2 oz espresso, I have a super great supply of great coffee from a local roaster, but also use beans from Starbucks too. I have a manual grinder that is great. Together with this maker, I am so very satisfied with this- easy to use and clean... perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit of technique, and great espresso results
customer_reviews.text: Read the directions and you'll be making good espresso right out of the gate. A bit of technique (controlling the heat for a steady stream of caramel colored goodness), and the espresso will be even better. Its big enough to make two cappucinos or lattes. I can't speak to the durability yet, but if its anything like the miniature one I have for car camping, it'll do its job for a long time, as I've had the small one for 10+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: A simple way for delicious espresso
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help brew a reasonable cup of espresso (to cut down my Starbucks spending). I was pleasantly surprised by how easy this machine is to use and how well it brews. A simple setup and just as easy to break down and clean when its done. I'm glad I found something like this, as every other type of espresso brewer was going to cost hundreds or more. I've used this daily now for about a week and it makes a good strong brew perfect for an americano.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wood

customer_reviews.title: Quality old school espresso
customer_reviews.text: This unit makes espresso way stronger than the american brands do. It's not as quick and convenient as the other brands (nespresso etc.) but it's old school taste is better.
customer_reviews.author: Chargerinheaven

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee machine
customer_reviews.text: This espresso maker makes the best flavored coffee. It doesn't take that long, only five minutes or less. I start with hot water and use 21/2 tablespoons for a full pot of good tasting espresso. I have a glass stove. It's easy to clean and you can take it anywhere! I'm so excited to make coffee for my husband and I every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Angela A. Gates

customer_reviews.title: Great little stovetop espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an old Bialetti espresso maker with this one and it works exactly as well as our last one. Since we use ours daily over the span of many years, the bottom area tends to blacken, so I really prefer to buy them with a black bottom. The black finish on the entire piece looks cool, so why not! Great coffee, every day.
customer_reviews.author: G. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of espresso.
customer_reviews.text: I wash this pot regularly, but I can not clean certain parts thoroughly. The lid seems a bit cheap, and the filter basket seems like it is very cheap and will not last very long. Mind you I have owned this a few months. Lastly the pressure relief goes off sometimes, cant figure out why. My mistake is not ordering one a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: KSJ

customer_reviews.title: Bellemain 6-cup Stovetop Espresso Maker
customer_reviews.text: When I was deciding about purchasing this, I checked the questions section to see if it was stainless steel. The answer: It IS stainless steel. The reality: It is stainless steel inside, and the outside is aluminum! Disappointing. The answer has been changed now so that buyers will know the truth.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: I was in Italy and liked their coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I was in Italy and every where we went they made fun of American coffee. This is how they make coffee. Everyone owns one. I looked at the price in a mercado and thought $35 euros is nuts. I went to amazon, ordered it to arrive the day I got back. I had rich full flavor coffee the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but not useless either.
customer_reviews.text: It makes a decent cup of coffee but a horrible shot of espresso. Those cheap $5 Vietnamese pour over makers make a better shot than this thing. I'll stick with my ancient Krups when I want an espresso and save the Bellamain for camping.

customer_reviews.title: Does its job.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's meant to. Worth the $18 I paid for it. Not worth any more though. The only annoying thing about it is that it's very quiet. When it starts to percolate you can't hear the steam venting so you don't realize it's ready. You have to watch it and listen for the boiling. A little more of a hiss or whistle would be great.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many of these in the past, but this one is definitely the best so far. Usually the handles always break off easily on ones I have bought before, but this handle is still sturdy and hanging in there. No leakage of water and the coffee is made super quick. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Julia L.

customer_reviews.title: Rust on the inside after less than 1 year use
customer_reviews.text: This espresso maker is very easy to use however after a few washes the metal looking material washed off and I noticed rust inside the bottom part. Looks like after not even 1 year of use I have to throw this one away. My mother owns a similar model and has been using for 10 + years now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: IS

customer_reviews.title: It's great. Just great.
customer_reviews.text: Ok so it took me a few times to get this right but after I got the hang of it I love it. I burnt my coffee the first time and the second time had the heat up way too high so it ended up boiling over and making a huge mess. Now I'm a master and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Clark

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of the plastic handle
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I couldn’t use it. My dad had one and made espresso all the time. I purchased one and got set up and ready to roll. I left it on the burner to do its thing. Handle melted off when trying to make my cup of espresso.... Really wished I could of actually used it.
customer_reviews.author: ThemodGTek

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: The pot arrived a day early. I bought this to use at work. It is one of 3 I use at work, at home ,and at the lake. It makes great coffee (espresso i guess). I recommend this brand. I recently bought the first one that showed up on Amazon. It was a waste of money. I've been using these for about 4 years now. I'm no pro but i feel confident in my ability to brew coffee. That said the off brand pot I bought wouldn't even empty the water reservoir. Again, I would recommend this pot and seller.
customer_reviews.author: chris b

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee small profile
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker on my son's recommendation and I'm glad I did. It makes good espresso, and has a very small footprint. I'm tired of appliances on my counters. I microwave milk then add the espresso for what I think is a delicious easy home cappuccino. It is quick and easy and minimal to clean up. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: C Koni

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we ordered  - great value
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this project - be careful when you are removing and cleaning basket - it is soft and to deform unless you are careful. BUT for the price I am very pleased and it and how it works
customer_reviews.author: James J. Post

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I received an opened box with a pot missing pieces and crumbs of old coffee inside the pot. This is unacceptable and shocking considering the necessity of sanitation during covid. I’m absolutely horrified.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Singh

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this instead of the Bialetti which I have bought for years. This pine was a little cheaper in price but the quality of the product is great. it brews great coffee and is easy to clean. I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Mercurio

customer_reviews.title: ESPRESSO!
customer_reviews.text: I was gonna invest in some big fancy machine, but then I saw this. I am thrilled with my purchase. The only issue I have with this is the amount it makes. I feel compelled to drink it all which is about 6 servings. (haha). I should have gotten a smaller one, but I still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Thomas

customer_reviews.title: It’s so annoying. And I have used a lot of these ...
customer_reviews.text: Everytime I make coffee using this it’s leaking from the middle part. It’s so annoying. And I have used a lot of these before, it’s not supposed to leak.
customer_reviews.author: Iulia

customer_reviews.title: Makes good espresso, great value
customer_reviews.text: After traveling to Italy and "discovering" this type of coffee maker, I had to get one when I returned to the US. I chose this one due to a) the price and b) all the positive reviews it had. So far, so good. It works very well and makes great espresso. No complaints at all. Easy to clean and use. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sean B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent coffee pot
customer_reviews.text: As a coffee ADDICT, this is one if the best purchases I have ever made. You will not regret spending the small amount of money after you taste the aburdly delicious, strong, and bold coffee that comes out of this device. It's easy to figure out and cleaning it is a breeze. RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: J M S

customer_reviews.title: Ahhh, now that's real coffee.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this. It works great and dishwasher safe. For those who did not grow up in a cuban home you must expect a change in the color after first use and cleaning. This is normal. The metal naturally changes color when expeosed to soaps for cleaning. Love my maker.
customer_reviews.author: Angelina R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this little espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: Love this little espresso maker. The only thing that would make it better? BIGGER since we love our coffee and can now leave the coffee shop line and make espresso at home, saving money too!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I grew up around this type of coffee brewer and I just needed to have one. Brings back memeories with my Mom. Ok so I thank Amazon for the quick delivery. What originally wanted was the silver all around look but they sent me the black, am not a fussy person so I'm ok with it now..I just got my order on 9.29.20.. I tried it the same night I received it and I love it..works great..I hope to continue to use this baby for a long time...
customer_reviews.author: Dominicanbaby..

customer_reviews.title: Don’t pass this up!
customer_reviews.text: So I did away with my Keurig and got this. Best decision ever! This makes the absolute best expressos!! You will not be disappointed. A little more work yes but so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sansburn

customer_reviews.title: Best way to make espresso
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the best way to make espresso without a $2,000 machine. I’ve tried machines that have great ratings and cost a few hundred bucks and they still don’t make espresso like this old-fashioned inexpensive jewel 💎. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: LianahModeling

customer_reviews.title: ALUMINUM
customer_reviews.text: I realized I couldn't keep due to aluminum. Pot was smaller than I expected. Didnt look awesome, just acceptable. And then ... aluminum. I can't.
customer_reviews.author: LIBRARY GIRL

customer_reviews.title: Good enough, sort of leaky.
customer_reviews.text: It’s cute, came quick, came with at least some instruction, but it’s got this leak by the handle. I took a video. I’ve been using it for a week. I tried tightening the screw under the handle but that didn’t fix it. It still makes good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: Makes a powerful cup of espresso, but don't use too fine of coffee grounds or some will end up in the brew. Easy to clean except for the inside of the filter spout. Overall an excellent device, definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Tweedt

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product and will last a lifetime! I’ve used this several times already. Only thing I wish was the espresso was stronger hence the four stars.Also I have seen reviews where the metal paint is rubbing off. It clearly states do not use In dishwasher and must be hand washed only. I hand wash mine and haven’t had this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: the handle is heat proof and I have had no problems with the parts and my drinks taste great. The cons are that it becomes burnt on ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for a few months now and it is my first espresso pot. The Pros are that it is well made, the handle is heat proof and I have had no problems with the parts and my drinks taste great. The cons are that it becomes burnt on the bottom and discolored on the inside after use because of the dark espresso powder as well as the heat from the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Saleena

customer_reviews.title: Best Espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: I love the coffee this pot makes! I think every household that has coffee drinkers should own one, and if you have never had an espresso from this type of coffee maker, you really need to try it (and use Espresso coffee). I also highly recommend this company for purchasing this Espresso maker.
customer_reviews.author: Irene Tienda-Rumbaut

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, easy to brew and easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: A new for me but classic way to brew that perfect cup of coffee. Inspired because my children, who had both ordered this product, I was absolutely thrilled with my very first cup. Getting the chance to enjoy my grandmother’s antique demi tasse cups with a delicious brewed coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect espresso with no fuss at all
customer_reviews.text: I love these European espresso pots! I use mine every morning for my breakfast latté and am so glad to have discovered them! Great for traveling, too, if you’ll have a stovetop.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love making my espresso with this device. I’ve never made espresso before and wasn’t quite sure I’d even want to continue so I opted for something simple. However I intend to stick with this. I love it. It’s so quick to brew the espresso. And it takes only a minute to clean. I also like the minimal look of it in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great expresso maker for strong brews.

customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent Espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: I saw this item on Amazon for a long time. I am constantly looking for a better cup of coffee, and I like strong coffee. When this arrived I followed the instructions, and I have been enjoying great espresso ever since. The quality seems great so far. The method of making brew is simple, and the result is excellent. I wonder why I didn't order this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence T

customer_reviews.title: Easy espresso, like I’m in Italy again!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after enjoying espresso fr similar in Tuscany. Easy enough to use. Just have to play around with coffee ground measurement. Wish it came with some sort of guide on that.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine G.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty gasket??
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of a moka pot! Pulling a really good espresso at home without getting a really fancy (and expensive) espresso machine is amazing! However this one frequently leaks from the side no matter how clean the rim is before I screw it together, no matter how tight I screw it. I wonder if I got a dud gasket or if the pot just has a design flaw. It works but my Grosche pot is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Abdallah

customer_reviews.title: Makes great espresso.
customer_reviews.text: I have used a variety of other espresso makers, and this one is great. Worked perfectly from the first pot. Just follow the simple cleaning instructions before making your first pot of espresso. After that it is a breeze. By the way, NEVER wash your pot in soap and water, just hot water alone. Really.
customer_reviews.author: C. H. Acunto

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee, but you wouldn't want to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes great coffee, but you wouldn't want to use it during summer if you live in a hot climate unless you really have the AC blasting. But in winter, the heat, steam and aroma it generates are welcome. As to the quality, I have no opinion. It's so simple and so inexpensive that if it wears out, I would not hesitate to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Easily lost

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee

Thank you

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good

Not necessary but it is something that makes it better

customer_reviews.title: Works great- helpful tips if you're new to brewing with a moka
customer_reviews.text: It's my first time using a moka. Once I got the hang of it (which took me a few tries- this was fine as the instructions request you do a few brews to season the pot before actual use, and also provide helpful troubleshooting tips if you're having trouble) it tastes fantastic. The pot itself seems well made and was easy to use. I doubt I'll ever make drip coffee at home again.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: Quality product - glad I tried the Bellemain brand
customer_reviews.text: I'm an espresso addict and couldn't start my day without a strong cup. I owned numerous Bialetti Moka Pots over the last decade and decided to try the Bellemain brand for a change, and I've been pleasantly surprised with the quality of the pot and most importantly the quality of the coffee. If you follow the instructions, you will get a quality espresso each and every time. Pot is easy to use, easy to wash, and I like it's sleek style. Glad I took a chance with a new company that is in America!
customer_reviews.author: MEJ

customer_reviews.title: Great moka pot!
customer_reviews.text: I use this moka pot for espresso and regular coffee -- or mixing the two. The pot is easy to clean and use. It also doesn't leak very much (if at all) when I pour the coffee out. This pot does take longer to heat up than my smaller one. Heat up the water first before putting it into the bottom half. Also, when the water is boiling I reduce the heat to medium low to keep it brewing, but not burn.
customer_reviews.author: Lyly Galarza-Punter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, love!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use/clean and reminds me of my trip to Europe every time I use it. Coffee is nice and strong, I grind the beans in between the consistency of what I would use for drip coffee and an espresso machine.

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso/ coffee maker but a little on the small side
